title: Budd-Chiari Syndrome: Clinical Overview and Diagnostic Approaches
short_description: Clinical document describing Budd-Chiari syndrome, a rare disorder involving hepatic vein obstruction, its symptoms, and diagnostic methods.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of Budd-Chiari syndrome, a rare vascular disorder characterized by narrowing and obstruction of hepatic veins. The document details the clinical presentation including abdominal pain, hepatomegaly, ascites, and potential complications such as portal hypertension. It covers the demographic distribution, affecting males and females equally between ages 20-40, and outlines the diagnostic approach utilizing angiography, MRI, ultrasound, and liver biopsy. The document serves as an educational resource for healthcare professionals to understand the pathophysiology, clinical manifestations, and diagnostic strategies for this uncommon hepatic vascular condition.
